Topic.Title: If I wanna make one based on a fandom is it ok?

Posts.EditableText:
Like, say I wanna make a BookQuest based on My Little Pony or the such, or any other show, as long as I don't take credit for the series itself is it ok?


Bonus Question: Is there a maturity limit?

Posts.EditableText: Whether or not creating such a derivative work is an infringement of copyright is debatable. I think it would be similar in substance to fan fiction. You can read all about it here: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Legal_issu ... an_fiction So it's up to you about *creating* the work. However, as far as posting it here on the textadventures site, it's fairly clear when you go to upload that you need to have the copyright for what you're posting. So (interpreting based on my opinion): you can create what you like, but if it has even the possibility of copyright infringement, don't post it here. (Someone can correct me if I'm wrong.) [To be honest, some probably already have posted such types of work here with little or no consequence, but I doubt it can be the official line, and there's no guarantee it will be allowed to stay.]

Posts.EditableText: Well most of my work is fan fiction. I give credit where credit is due, but I am not making a profit from any of this. Although the game is practically completed, minus the conversations and a few more puzzles and rooms, it is done until I add the "polish" to it as it were. And I have read that one io9 post as well as a few others and feel I am not infringing. I would hate to find all that hard work wasted because Quest wont allow it to be played openly.

Posts.EditableText: Well as long as Quest doesn't say, "Sorry, this is a fan fic and we can not post it...", just because it is a fan fic, I really do not have a problem. Although I will admit it would be disheartening if the copyright holders would ask me to cease and desist. And yet when it is all said and done, they should be thanking me. This is a totally different take on an existing story, which I would hope would have people buy more of their existing and future products as I have. This is a work of love, not a parody. Regardless, I shall not say what the copyright material is because that was the reason I refused to post my code and why I only used sample codes when I had to. It is a surprise. And yes I saw stuff like Star Wars and My Little Pony on here and I am not sure about Lord of the Rings, but I know there are countless MUDs that have that and I doubt each one has permission. And again, since I am not turning a coin or really even harming theirs, but they might possibly gain from it, maybe they will put a little bit back into my pocket. Hahaha! That last bit was a joke of course, but I wont stand to make a penny on this so what ever so ehhh... And even if I did then I would have to pay Alex for his wonderful game engine and also those I used works from with their permission, etc. and that would be even more things I have to keep track of...

Posts.EditableText: Don't worry about it and keep on creating. Unless you're using audio/video/image files you don't have a licence for: it's ok to worry about that. Fiction is your work even if it's derivative. Media not created by yourself falls into a different area.
